channel.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
channel.description:
Don't you think so? I think that the reason private servers are not as popular as it should be is because most of us(RSC players - take note that very few new players actually enter the scene) are older now and do not have much time for RSC anymore. Furthermore, no one wants to risk putting in so much effort for a possibility(quite high actually) that the server may shut down.
Allowing afk training or autoing will bring about... [u]Pros [/u] - Many more people will be playing RSC again - Most private servers will become active since players just have to leave their clients on and can actively play on multiple servers - The games' economies will grow much faster; Items will reach an equilibrated price faster(I do not really know how to explain this because I do not study economics but I know how economies work) - It allows for the rsc or rscd type of servers(which are personally my favourite type) to resurface instead of all servers being based on storkpk's. - Admins/mods no longer need to have the responsibility of banning players - It saves alot of the players' time, and players will take the game less seriously and so this may lead to a better community in-game.
[u]Cons[/u] - Server owners will need to upgrade their servers to accommodate e the many more people that will be playing - Many people are going to end up with similiar stats - for example, three smithers racing to 99 will probably progress at the same pace and so it takes away the competition.
This thought just came to my mind an hour ago and I thought I should post it and see what others think about it.. and I urge someone to launch a server based on this idea and see the results,

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

When you ran your own server you’ll realize this isn’t a good suggestions. Why auto when you can simply higher the XP gained? With everything being easy, everything will turn boring soon also.

Read full topic

item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @pljay03 pljay03
item.description:
@pljay03 wrote:

I agree with somewhat of what you have to say. I mean, “AFKing” should be allowed seeing as how it’s apart of every game, including real RuneScape. Macroing (“autoing”), however, shouldn’t be allowed, it just ruins the game.

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @mgffx2 mgffx2
item.description:
@mgffx2 wrote:

tbh ko9, its fair for everyone if everyone autos. but yea… i wouldn’t think it’d be a good idea for you to allow autoing as your server has been around for 3 months already which means many people have trained their asses off.

p.S: Could you upload your client to a different hoster, i can’t d/l from rapidshare and upit seems have deleted the file

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

I’m really split on this topic tbh part of me wants to just allow autoing on my server and be done with it. But the other part of me feels sorry for all of the players on there who have already trained their asses off and the many more that want to play in a fair environment.

The problem is, you can implement methods upon methods upon methods of anti-cheating [methods], but if your server is popular there are always people who are going to get around them. (Think copyright RIAA/MPAA etc but on a [much] smaller scale).

Then there’s the fact that none of us are Jagex… If you ban someone from your server they will [more-than likely] go to another server and seeing as this entire community was born from the RSC cheating community I’d be confident in saying a large portion of people playing RSC private servers have botted on RSC at one point or another.

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @mgffx2 mgffx2
item.description:
@mgffx2 wrote:

either way you would still be paying for the server, i think admins would be glad to see many more people on their servers. Most of us here had been autoing on RSC before we went on to private servers, and I’m sure many would agree that autoing has been and still part of RSC.

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Google ads + webclient will change that fealing, drastically.

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Ok, you spend all your time editing a server ect making it good for people then pay out of your own pocket money to set it all up, then let some little tosser spend hours cheating on it. Let’s see how you feel.

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @Diesel Diesel
item.description:
@Diesel wrote:

But when the user isn’t playing anyway then your in a tight situation aren’t ya…
So when you have to pick a user that from time to time plays or a user who doesnt play at all…who would you pick ?

Imo autoing shouldn’t be a way of gameplay .

Read full topic

item.description:
@zraffz wrote:

The main problem with autoing is it’s a waste of bandwith if the user isn’t really playing.

I don’t think this will make any difference.
RSC sure is fun, but I just don’t know. You can try it as an experiment?

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @alexdevinson alexdevinson
item.description:
@alexdevinson wrote:

Because server development is not always about code, you’ve got several issues involving player relations that can heavily impact your server. Not that I care, imo, afk training is autoing and shouldn’t be allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Private servers should allow for afktraining/autoing
item.dc:creator: @mgffx2 mgffx2
item.description:
@mgffx2 wrote:

Don’t you think so? I think that the reason private servers are not as popular as it should be is because most of us(RSC players - take note that very few new players actually enter the scene) are older now and do not have much time for RSC anymore. Furthermore, no one wants to risk putting in so much effort for a possibility(quite high actually) that the server may shut down.

Allowing afk training or autoing will bring about…
Pros

  • Many more people will be playing RSC again
  • Most private servers will become active since players just have to leave their clients on and can actively play on multiple servers
  • The games’ economies will grow much faster; Items will reach an equilibrated price faster(I do not really know how to explain this because I do not study economics but I know how economies work)
  • It allows for the rsc or rscd type of servers(which are personally my favourite type) to resurface instead of all servers being based on storkpk’s.
  • Admins/mods no longer need to have the responsibility of banning players
  • It saves alot of the players’ time, and players will take the game less seriously and so this may lead to a better community in-game.

Cons

  • Server owners will need to upgrade their servers to accommodate e the many more people that will be playing
  • Many people are going to end up with similiar stats - for example, three smithers racing to 99 will probably progress at the same pace and so it takes away the competition.

This thought just came to my mind an hour ago and I thought I should post it and see what others think about it… and I urge someone to launch a server based on this idea and see the results,
